Hi, Ken. 

This is a good idea and I'll try to implement one. It should be =
easy, 
like writing a paint program. :)
Something came to my mind right now=
. Such a GUI should support general 
node placement concepts too (like arra=
nging nodes in a circle or a 
matrix), so the same substrate file can be re=
used in multiple node 
densities. 

Peter

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ke=
nneth Stanley" <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
> I know this is going to happen soo=
ner or later, but Thomas's recent 
> question brought it to mind.  It will =
be really interesting someday 
to 
> be able to set up substrates with a GU=
I, so you can intuitively 
specify 
> how inputs/outputs/hidden nodes are c=
onfigured and run a range of 
> experiments quickly.  There are many ways t=
hat such an app could be 
set 
> up but however it works it would certainly=

> conjunction with a HyperNEAT system.

> ken
